answers.answer: I'm 28 weeks and been dealing with the dizziness my whole pregnancy. Its awful. Someone told me to eat boiled eggs or something with lots of protein.  I found that helped me a lot. I eat lots of peanut butter and apples too. Hope that helps a little bit. I'm sure u will get a few better answers then mine. Good luck.
I went through this as well. I found out it was because I have gestational diabetes. Have you had your diabetes test yet?
Yes. I passed my test last week. That's why I think it's so random.

I've been dizzy my whole pregnancy too. My midwife says its a drop in my blood pressure. Also blood volume and the really hot summer I'm having (live in San Diego).  She keeps saying its completely normal although never experienced this with my son.

question: This morning I woke up and felt really off balance. I had a bagel and 2 bottles of water. I went to work and felt like I was going to faint. I am now at home resting but still feel very dizzy. Is this normal or has it ever happened to you? I can feel my little man moving but it just makes me nervous. Thanks for your help.
title: So dizzy 27 weeks
